title: Understand the Structure
text: The equation given is $${\left(x-1\right)}^2=25$$. Think about what it means to have a square on one side equal to a number on the other side.

title: Apply the Square Root Property
text: To remove the square, you'll need to take the square root of both sides. What happens to the equation when you do this?

title: Solving for $$x$$
text: Once the square root is applied, the equation becomes $$x-1=\sqrt{25}$$ or $$x-1=-\sqrt{25}$$. Can you write these as separate equations?

title: Solving Each Equation
text: For each of the separate equations $$x-1=5$$ and $$x-1=-5$$, add $$1$$ to both sides. What do you get?

title: Final Solution
text: You should end up with $$x=6$$ and $$x=-4$$. Check if these values satisfy the original equation $${\left(x-1\right)}^2=25$$.
